leverages LLMs to (1) approximate the framing-to-belief oracle, and (2)
optimize over language space using a hill-climbing method. We apply this to two
marketing-inspired case studies and validate the effectiveness through
analytical and human evaluation.

</details>


### [734] [Quadratic Programming Approach for Nash Equilibrium Computation in Multiplayer Imperfect-Information Games](https://arxiv.org/abs/2509.25618)
*Sam Ganzfried*

Main category: cs.GT

TL;DR: 该论文提出了一种计算多人非完美信息博弈中纳什均衡的新方法，该方法基于序列形式博弈表示的非线性互补问题，并利用了解决非凸二次规划的最新进展。


<details>
  <summary>Details</summary>
Motivation: 现有的纳什均衡计算算法在多人博弈中存在收敛性问题，而该方法旨在解决多人非完美信息博弈中纳什均衡的精确计算问题。

Method: 提出了一种基于序列形式博弈表示的非线性互补问题，并将其转化为二次约束规划问题来求解。该方法利用了解决非凸二次规划的最新进展。

Result: 该算法能够快速解决三方库恩扑克牌博弈，并且优于Gambit软件套件中的其他算法，尤其是logit quantal response方法，后者虽然能解决该博弈但耗时更长且涉及近似。

Conclusion: 该方法为多人非完美信息博弈提供了一种精确计算纳什均衡的有效途径，并且在多人战略形式博弈的计算上也优于先前的二次约束规划方法。

Abstract: There has been significant recent progress in algorithms for approximation of
Nash equilibrium in large two-player zero-sum imperfect-information games and
exact computation of Nash equilibrium in multiplayer strategic-form games.
While counterfactual regret minimization and fictitious play are scalable to
large games and have convergence guarantees in two-player zero-sum games, they
do not guarantee convergence to Nash equilibrium in multiplayer games. We
present an approach for exact computation of Nash equilibrium in multiplayer
imperfect-information games that solves a quadratically-constrained program
based on a nonlinear complementarity problem formulation from the sequence-form
game representation. This approach capitalizes on recent advances for solving
nonconvex quadratic programs. Our algorithm is able to quickly solve
three-player Kuhn poker after removal of dominated actions. Of the available
algorithms in the Gambit software suite, only the logit quantal response
approach is successfully able to solve the game; however, the approach takes
longer than our algorithm and also involves a degree of approximation. Our
formulation also leads to a new approach for computing Nash equilibrium in
multiplayer strategic-form games which we demonstrate to outperform a previous
quadratically-constrained program formulation.

</details>


### [735] [Achieving Pareto Optimality in Games via Single-bit Feedback](https://arxiv.org/abs/2509.25921)
*Seref Taha Kiremitci,Ahmed Said Donmez,Muhammed O. Sayin*

Main category: cs.GT

TL;DR: SBC-PE是一种去中心化的学习算法，仅需每个智能体每轮一个比特的满意度信号，就能在任意有限博弈中收敛到精确的最优解，并且具有O(log T)的对数遗憾界限，实现了在最小通信约束下的可扩展福利优化。


<details>
  <summary>Details</summary>
Motivation: 多智能体系统中高效协调面临通信开销大或收敛速度慢的挑战，阻碍了可扩展的福利优化。

Method: 提出了一种名为SBC-PE（Single-Bit Coordination Dynamics for Pareto-Efficient Outcomes）的去中心化学习算法，该算法仅使用每个智能体每轮一个比特的满意度信号。

Result: SBC-PE保证在任意有限博弈中收敛到精确的最优解，并具有O(log T)的对数增长的预期遗憾界限。

Conclusion: SBC-PE算法实现了通信效率和最优解收敛性的结合，证明了在通信约束下实现可扩展福利优化是可行的。

Abstract: Efficient coordination in multi-agent systems often incurs high communication
overhead or slow convergence rates, making scalable welfare optimization
difficult. We propose Single-Bit Coordination Dynamics for Pareto-Efficient
Outcomes (SBC-PE), a decentralized learning algorithm requiring only a
single-bit satisfaction signal per agent each round. Despite this extreme
efficiency, SBC-PE guarantees convergence to the exact optimal solution in
arbitrary finite games. We establish explicit regret bounds, showing expected
regret grows only logarithmically with the horizon, i.e., O(log T). Compared
with prior payoff-based or bandit-style rules, SBC-PE uniquely combines minimal
signaling, general applicability, and finite-time guarantees. These results
show scalable welfare optimization is achievable under minimal communication
constraints.

</details>

### [736] [Improved capabilities of the TurboGAP code for radiation induced cascade simulations: an illustration with silicon](https://arxiv.org/abs/2509.26199)
*Uttiyoarnab Saha,Ali Hamedani,Miguel A. Caro,Andrea E. Sand*

Main category: physics.app-ph

TL;DR: TurboGAP通过引入双温分子动力学模型、自适应计算和新的电子阻止模型，增强了其在辐射损伤模拟方面的能力，并能模拟高达10 keV PKA能量和百万原子规模的硅材料。


<details>
  <summary>Details</summary>
Motivation: 为了更有效地模拟材料在辐射损伤下的行为，特别是考虑到电子和原子子系统之间的耦合以及辐射引起的能量传递过程。

Method: 在TurboGAP软件中实现了一个基于电子密度依赖耦合的双温分子动力学模型，并加入了自适应时间步长和原子分组技术。同时，集成了传统摩擦模型和基于第一性原理的电子阻止模型。

Result: 在硅材料中进行了高达10 keV PKA能量的辐射损伤模拟，系统规模可达百万原子。研究了辐射诱导缺陷的产生和聚集，计算了离子束混合效应，并将结果与实验数据进行了对比，验证了GAP-MLIP和新的电子阻止模型在预测实验混合值方面的改进。

Conclusion: GAP-MLIP结合新的电子阻止模型能够更准确地预测材料的辐射损伤行为，如离子束混合效应，显著提高了模拟的效率和精度。

Abstract: TurboGAP is a software package designed for efficient molecular dynamics
simulations using Gaussian Approximation Potential (GAP) machine-learning
interatomic potentials (MLIP). In this work, we enhance the capabilities of
TurboGAP for radiation damage simulations by implementing a two-temperature
molecular dynamics model, based on electron density-dependent coupling of
electronic and atomic subsystems. Additionally, we implement adaptive
calculation of the timestep and grouping of atoms for cell-border cooling. Our
implementation incorporates electronic stopping power either through a
traditional friction-based model or a more realistic first-principles-derived
model. By combining the computational efficiency of TurboGAP with the accuracy
of GAP MLIP, we perform cascade simulations in silicon with primary knock-on
atom (PKA) energies up to 10 keV. Our simulations scale to systems containing
up to 1 million atoms. We study the generation and clustering of
radiation-induced defects. We also calculate ion-beam mixing and compare our
results with the experimental data, discussing how the GAP-MLIP along with the
inclusion of a realistic electronic stopping model improves the prediction of
experimental mixing values.

</details>


### [737] [Increase in packing density during multi-layer powder spreading: An experimental and numerical study](https://arxiv.org/abs/2509.26402)
*Olivier Gaboriault,Anatolie Timercan,Roger Pelletier,Louis-Philippe Lefebvre,David Melancon,Bruno Blais*

Main category: physics.app-ph

TL;DR: 实验和模拟均发现，在制造过程中，多层金属粉末的堆积密度在5-10层之后会突然增加，这与粉末铺展区域的尺寸有关。


<details>
  <summary>Details</summary>
Motivation: 填补单层粉末铺展研究与实际增材制造过程之间的空白，深入了解多层铺展过程中粉末床的行为。

Method: 使用自定义设备分离和模拟金属粉末的铺展过程，并利用离散单元法（DEM）进行大规模多层模拟。

Result: 模拟结果重现了实验中观察到的堆积密度增加现象，并发现粉末床的颗粒位移和由围挡产生的静态区域是造成这种现象的原因。堆积密度的幅度和发生层数与围挡之间的距离相关。

Conclusion: 粉末床在多层铺展过程中的行为，特别是堆积密度的增加，受到铺展区域尺寸的影响，这对于理解和改进金属粉末增材制造过程至关重要。

Abstract: A custom apparatus designed to isolate and replicate the spreading process of
metal powder in additive manufacturing demonstrates a sudden and unexplained
increase in packing density beyond layers 5 to 10. We replicate the experiments
that lead to densification with the discrete element method (DEM) using
\lethe{}, an open-source software framework. We show that large-scale
multi-layer DEM simulations are able to reproduce the densification observed
experimentally. Using the Lagrangian simulation results, we highlight
significant particle displacement in the powder bed at lower layer number,
accompanied by static zones generated by the vertical wall surrounding the
powder bed. The amplitude of the densification and the layer number at which it
starts to occur is correlated to the distance between those two vertical walls
which delimit the powder spreading area. This study addresses the gap between
mono-layer powder spreading studies on hard-flat surfaces and the actual metal
powder-based additive manufacturing processes by providing a better
understanding of how the powder bed behaves during multi-layer spreading.

</details>

### [738] [Scaling Equilibrium Propagation to Deeper Neural Network Architectures](https://arxiv.org/abs/2509.26003)
*Sankar Vinayak. E. P,Gopalakrishnan Srinivasan*

Main category: cs.NE

TL;DR: Equilibrium propagation (EP) is a biologically plausible alternative to backpropagation, suitable for neuromorphic hardware. This work introduces the Hopfield-Resnet architecture with residual connections and clipped ReLU activation, enabling deeper networks and achieving accuracy comparable to backpropagation-trained Resnets.


<details>
  <summary>Details</summary>
Motivation: Previous equilibrium propagation models were limited to shallow architectures and had a significant accuracy gap compared to backpropagation-trained feedforward networks. This work aims to bridge this gap by introducing architectural enhancements.

Method: The paper introduces the Hopfield-Resnet architecture, which incorporates residual (skip) connections into Hopfield networks and uses clipped ReLU as the activation function. This allows for deeper networks than previously possible with EP.

Result: The proposed Hopfield-Resnet architecture enables the training of deeper networks. For example, Hopfield-Resnet13 achieves 93.92% accuracy on CIFAR-10, surpassing previous EP results by ~3.5% and reaching accuracy comparable to backpropagation-trained Resnet13.

Conclusion: The Hopfield-Resnet architecture, by incorporating residual connections and clipped ReLU, significantly improves the performance and depth of networks trained with equilibrium propagation, making them competitive with backpropagation-based models.

Abstract: Equilibrium propagation has been proposed as a biologically plausible
alternative to the backpropagation algorithm. The local nature of gradient
computations, combined with the use of convergent RNNs to reach equilibrium
states, make this approach well-suited for implementation on neuromorphic
hardware. However, previous studies on equilibrium propagation have been
restricted to networks containing only dense layers or relatively small
architectures with a few convolutional layers followed by a final dense layer.
These networks have a significant gap in accuracy compared to similarly sized
feedforward networks trained with backpropagation. In this work, we introduce
the Hopfield-Resnet architecture, which incorporates residual (or skip)
connections in Hopfield networks with clipped $\mathrm{ReLU}$ as the activation
function. The proposed architectural enhancements enable the training of
networks with nearly twice the number of layers reported in prior works. For
example, Hopfield-Resnet13 achieves 93.92\% accuracy on CIFAR-10, which is
$\approx$3.5\% higher than the previous best result and comparable to that
provided by Resnet13 trained using backpropagation.

</details>


### [739] [The Dragon Hatchling: The Missing Link between the Transformer and Models of the Brain](https://arxiv.org/abs/2509.26507)
*Adrian Kosowski,Przemysław Uznański,Jan Chorowski,Zuzanna Stamirowska,Michał Bartoszkiewicz*

Main category: cs.NE

TL;DR: BDH是一个受生物启发的、具有可解释性的新型大规模语言模型架构，在性能上可与Transformer媲美，并在语言和翻译任务上表现出与GPT2相当的水平。


<details>
  <summary>Details</summary>
Motivation: 受计算系统与大脑关系的启发，旨在解决机器学习在通用推理模型方面的主要障碍，即随着时间的推移进行泛化。

Method: 提出了一种名为'Dragon Hatchling'（BDH）的新型大规模语言模型架构，该架构基于大规模无标度生物启发的神经网络，包含局部相互作用的神经元粒子。BDH结合了强大的理论基础、内在的可解释性以及类似Transformer的性能，并采用了基于突触可塑性和赫布学习的脉冲神经元工作记忆机制。

Result: BDH在保持与GPT2相当的参数量和训练数据的情况下，在语言和翻译任务上达到了可相媲美的性能。研究表明，BDH的激活向量是稀疏且正向的，并能在语言任务中实现单义性。其神经元相互作用网络表现出高度模块化和重尾度分布特征。

Conclusion: BDH架构在提供类似Transformer的性能的同时，还具有内在的可解释性，这超越了对单个神经元和模型参数的可解释性。该模型在生物学上是合理的，为人类神经元实现语音功能提供了一种可能的机制。

Abstract: The relationship between computing systems and the brain has served as
motivation for pioneering theoreticians since John von Neumann and Alan Turing.
Uniform, scale-free biological networks, such as the brain, have powerful
properties, including generalizing over time, which is the main barrier for
Machine Learning on the path to Universal Reasoning Models.
  We introduce `Dragon Hatchling' (BDH), a new Large Language Model
architecture based on a scale-free biologically inspired network of \$n\$
locally-interacting neuron particles. BDH couples strong theoretical
foundations and inherent interpretability without sacrificing Transformer-like
performance.
  BDH is a practical, performant state-of-the-art attention-based state space
sequence learning architecture. In addition to being a graph model, BDH admits
a GPU-friendly formulation. It exhibits Transformer-like scaling laws:
empirically BDH rivals GPT2 performance on language and translation tasks, at
the same number of parameters (10M to 1B), for the same training data.
  BDH can be represented as a brain model. The working memory of BDH during
inference entirely relies on synaptic plasticity with Hebbian learning using
spiking neurons. We confirm empirically that specific, individual synapses
strengthen connection whenever BDH hears or reasons about a specific concept
while processing language inputs. The neuron interaction network of BDH is a
graph of high modularity with heavy-tailed degree distribution. The BDH model
is biologically plausible, explaining one possible mechanism which human
neurons could use to achieve speech.
  BDH is designed for interpretability. Activation vectors of BDH are sparse
and positive. We demonstrate monosemanticity in BDH on language tasks.
Interpretability of state, which goes beyond interpretability of neurons and
model parameters, is an inherent feature of the BDH architecture.

</details>
